Understate: The claim may understate the provisions of H.R. 1 that require states to use "objective and reliable evidence" to remove ineligible voters.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not fully acknowledging the provisions in H.R. 1 that allow for the removal of ineligible voters from registration rolls.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the assertion that H.R. 1 would prevent the removal of ineligible voters from registration rolls.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that H.R. 1 would hinder the removal of ineligible voters, without considering the specific provisions and safeguards included in the legislation.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the claim may be based on a misinterpretation or misrepresentation of the provisions in H.R. 1.
